candidates.name: Felicity Foy
candidates.why_elect: With my knowledge gained as a councillor last term, and 12 years' experience as a town planner, I understand how to get things done. I listen and offer solutions. I and am not afraid to challenge the status quo.
candidates.why_stand: I love the Far North. I want the best for now, and also the future generations to come. We need to research and lobby central govt to be able to afford sustainable infrastructure and reduce the burden on the ratepayer.

candidates.name: Lillian Karaka
candidates.why_elect: I bring a wealth of experience having worked within government agencies, academic institutions, iwi boards, marae and community boards to effect positive change for families and communities. I am passionate about fostering and working with strong leadership from all sectors of our community for the well-being of our people.
candidates.why_stand: I have always considered the North to be my home, an extraordinary place to live. The true the value of partnering with, participating alongside and protecting our diverse communities is yet to be fully realized. I am committed to making these values that I grew up with a reality.

candidates.name: Sacha Kearney-Yanke
candidates.why_elect: I will make a good representative for Te Hiku because I've lived in this community with open eyes, witnessed the hardships and the current challenges and love the place. My legal education has given me professionalism, analytical and problem-solving experience and I am motivated to use it for greater good.
candidates.why_stand: My candidacy for FNDC is inspired by my desire to face the challenges to my community with proactive strategy, but also compassion and fairness. Our challenges are unique, but many are also global. I want to better our future by contributing my analytical skill and new ideas now.

candidates.name: Jason Kerrison
candidates.why_elect: I've written music all my life speaking to environmental degradation, the imbalance of energy consumption and waste generation, social injustice, and love of people and the planet. I've been successful in various industries and want to bring my creativity and thirst for a thriving Far North to its council.
candidates.why_stand: We should be exemplar to the country and world as a thriving destination that rivals Queenstown. The social contract between the FNDC and the citizens of Te Hiku has broken down, for too long we've been neglected. With tech, passion and compassion we could turn that around, and quickly.

candidates.name: Lyle Painting
candidates.why_elect: I just want to help make the North a better place for all our people and save our lands from being destroyed.
candidates.why_stand: I didn't want to do this but people kept bugging me to do it.

candidates.name: Hazely Windelborn
candidates.why_elect: I have a great understanding of the entire area and a lot of the concerns in our communities. I have experience in lots of committees and governance roles.
candidates.why_stand: A believe the our Rohe has been undervalued and misrepresented for so long and I want to change that.

candidates.name: Sue Bradford
candidates.why_elect: My family connections to the far north go back generations and I currently live in Taipa. If elected I will use my ten years' experience as a Green MP (1999-2009) and of decades of work with people in poverty to bring a progressive and thoughtful woman's voice to council.
candidates.why_stand: I believe local government has an increasingly critical role to play in dealing with the impacts of the climate, ecological, social, housing and economic crises facing our region and it is important that people who have constructive ideas on how to deal with these put themselves forward for council.
